Brazil: The first Rio Carnival happens to celebrate Dom João IV's coronation as king of Portugal.
Guaraní forces living in the Jesuit reductions defeat bandeirantes loyal to the Portuguese Empire at the Battle of Mbororé in present-day Panambí, Argentina.
Chile: The first large shipment of Fitzroya wood leaves Chiloé Archipelago.
Ireland: Irish Rebellion of 1641: Phelim O'Neill led the capture of several forts in the north of Ireland.
Malaysia: The Dutch and their local allies conquered Malacca from the Portuguese.
Singapore: Portuguese burn down a trading outpost at the mouth of Singapore River.
Taiwan: The Dutch attempt to oust the Spaniards from Jilong but fail
